basics.name: Erik Lenaerts
basics.label: Digital eXperience Architect @ Digipolis, Digital Business Coach @ Castles & Coffee
basics.summary:
From day one in my professional career, I started out working for as many companies as possible. I wanted to learn their business, their problems, opportunities, and the people behind. 

Today I'm fortunate to combine all my learnings when assisting companies who are venturing into the digital world. Together we design the details of new (digital) products or services. From here on, I help turn these dreams into practical and pragmatic executable steps. 
I believe strongly in putting good values upfront; solid business will flow naturally from it. In every step I ask myself the question; does it add value. Will it make the users, the customers â€¦ the life of people better and more enjoyable.

work.name: Castles & Coffee
work.summary:
In Castles & Coffee I help companies small to medium sized in 3 main areas:
- Going from an idea to a concept to a business
- Story creation for products & services
- Pragmatic and agile organisational structures 
Have a look at the site of castles & Coffee at www.castlescoffee.be

work.name: Digipolis
work.summary:
Digipolis is stepping up its game to improve the Digital Experience for everyone that lives, works, visits and studies in Antwerp. With the new Digital eXperience Platform initiative, we want to deliver the building blocks behind an improved digital city for its people. This foundation will drive future interactions between the people and the smart city. 

I'm lucky to part of this team where we put people - and how they experience the city - in the forefront. In this job, I can combine my architectural, marketing and user-centred experience skills all in one effort.

work.name: Digipolis
work.summary:
Guiding Digipolis and its customer, the city of Antwerp in their digital evolution. Digipolis is going full force ahead and innovates in the space of blockchain, IoT and the API ecosystems. 

Bridging the gap between the businesses in the city of Antwerp, the customer, and Digipolis is one of the key jobs I perform here.  Additionally, I coach business analysts, business architects, and others into the intricacies of today and tomorrows technology landscape.

work.name: Digipolis
work.summary:
I'm working in a team where we launch ACPaaS or Antwerp City Platform as a Service. If people ask me what it is, I tell them, its about wrapping Antwerp in API's.
I contribute by being a Product Owner for several engines (API's if you want). Next to this PO role I help in solution designs and assist in various related projects depending on ACPaaS. Last but not least, I lead some of the marketing initiatives for ACPaaS.

work.name: Line20
work.summary:
Digital coach, Enterprise Architect, Digital Marketing, growth hacking & culture designer.
Love guiding companies and into a digital world whilst working in the meanwhile on a solid culture foundation. Assist in bringing these ideas into the market and designing the org structure to create happy workspaces.

work.name: Narato
work.summary:
It is my goal to design, shape and facilitate the culture within Narato during its startup period. People, planet and profit are considered equal goals. We strive to create a culture of openess, transparancy and self-organising people that create innovative solutions. Composing software solutions that make the life of people more enjoyable is the purpose of the organisation.

In my second role, I want to setup and facilitate a content driven marketing environment. By offering quality content to our audience, we hope to inspire them just about enough for them to contact us and grab a coffee. From there on, it's about dreaming together and figuring out a common solution.

work.name: E2 Partners
work.summary:
Currently co-designing the new business initiatives within E2 Partners. Helping them out with their business models and their value propositions. Helping them build their brand and culture as they grow their businesses.

Constantly looking out for new trends in the digital marketing space. Learning on the one end and experimenting it on the other within the E2 initiatives in a constant loop of improvement.

The E2 initiatives are 
www.kapture.be
www.pulsehcs.be
www.narato.be

work.name: E2 Partners
work.summary: Guiding a group of Solution and Enterprise Architect consultants.

work.name: E2 Partners
work.summary: e2 is a young dynamic company with lots of experienced people. We aim to provide unbiased assistance in the field of software solutions and infrastructure. Our goal is to get the business closer to the IT and the other way around.

work.name: Wolters Kluwer Belgium
work.summary: Working in Kluwer's content division on a program where the goals are to improve operational efficiency, faster GTM. In the program I aided to take a continuous business improvement approach with translations towards the IT landscape.

work.name: AG Insurance
work.summary: I worked on defining the governance approach for AG Insurance new internet, intranet and extranet strategy.

work.name: Truvo
work.summary:
I started the first year in the field of Sales Force Automation. As Architect/Advisor where I delivered structure in the application life cycle of the SFA software. 
In the second year and onwards, the focus changed to more enterprise oriented architecture work.

work.name: MSP
work.summary:
As a Solution Consultant I help customers in the early stages of their projects. The goal is to turn their problems into solutions according to today's industry standards.

In the job I provide assessments of their current legacy systems, define together the goal and how to reach it. This includes lots of presentations, performing audits, defining architectures and grinding for business requirements.

I perform this activities in 2 distinct domains:
- Business Intelligence
- Microsoft Modernisation (wrapping Microsoft around legacy midrange/mainframe environments)

work.name: Amadeus
work.summary: Responsible for the Development of ACEmis Business Intelligence Software.

work.name: Advanced Solutions
work.summary: Co-founder & CTO of Advanced Solutions, a software company focused on Mobile Information Integration and Internet Solutions & Services.

work.name: Dolmen
work.summary: Working as c++ developer for various customers like Johnson & Johnson, Marlux, etc.

references.name: John Milton
references.reference: Erik is an eceptional individual, full of life and drive and commitment and a highly talented Enterprise Architect who is a top class communicator and diplomat. He can bring together people from distant entrenched positions to seek a common architecture that meets the real business needs of an organization. If you are looking for someone who can bring root and branch changes to your landscape, without leaving a tangled spaghetti architecture behind, he is your man.

references.name: Anja Ramaekers
references.reference:
I had the pleasure of working with Erik during the creation of a strategic plan to turn around and help transform the business & IT.  He is a hard working and trustful professional who can fluently switch between addressing business challenges and making translations to IT topics. Erik has many great ideas, knowledge & vision on transformation and enterprise architectural topics.  
I appreciated in particular his collaborative attitude and his role as facilitator which he assumed in a very natural way to make sure that all different opinions and approaches were discussed.  He is someone you can count on and I would recommend Erik as a highly professional person who can work on all levels of the organisation to make the difference and carry on in situations where other people tend to give up.

references.name: Gunter Gheysens
references.reference: I worked with Erik on several implementation projects within Truvo. He, as an architect for the front office applications, myself as an architect for the back office apps. Erik has a strong mindset, knows what he's doing and certainly has very good technical skills.  Notwithstanding, he is a good listener as well. I appriciated his openness and drive to meet business targets and requirements. Due to restructuring, our cooperation was ended  but I'm already looking forward to work with Erik again.... somewhere, sometime.

references.name: Geoffrey Smolders
references.reference: I've placed Erik at Truvo quite a while ago as a Team Lead / Architect for a .NET team existing of Truvo & Cronos consultants. Erik was a 100% match for this job. He is truly a good architect with good vision and not afraid to make his own hands dirty and develop along with the team. He is also very communicative and can easily relate and understand the needs of the business. I wouldn't hesitate to put Erik on any other Lead Developer or Architect role in the future.

references.name: Wouter E. M. Berben
references.reference:
Erik was my mentor when I was an intern at MSP. He told me some tricks I've not seen before and that does not reflect much on me but a lot on Erik. He's a the one to ask for an oppinion about the work you've have done.

Thank you Erik.

references.name: Sven Vanoirbeek
references.reference: During my internship Erik was my technical mentor. Eric has very good understanding of software engineering. He always gave me great tips and advice on how to improve my project. Thank you!

references.name: Rik Doclo
references.reference: Having known Eric already from previous assignments we had a real opportunity to work closely at Tyco Fire & Security Services. Eric is not only on personal level a highly appreciated individual, also as a professional he scores way above average !

references.name: Ken Vleminckx
references.reference: I worked together with Erik for three years. I very much enjoyed working together with him. He's very result-driven and dynamic in his job. Also, he knows how to deal with difficult customers/projects.

projects.name: IT Partner Selection for Smartmat
projects.summary: Rather small project where I helped out https://www.smartmat.be/nl/ in their search for a new partner of their IT backbone. I'd like to say that I've used an agile process for getting the right partner in a couple of weeks time.

projects.name: API-based publishing strategy for Sanoma Media Belgium
projects.summary: Sanoma asked us to help lay the foundations for their API-based publishing activities. We coached IT architects and developers through a paradigm shift from large-scale complex IT service integrations to the outside-in thinking that APIs require.

projects.name: TruST @ TRUVO Belgium
projects.summary:
Situation 2 (TruST)
TruST is the name of the sales application used by the commercial agent. It's development was done in an SCRUM/Agile environment. My task was to manage and improve the test quality and test capability in this agile environment.
